originalTitle: Nigerian court orders UK to pay £420m over 1949 killing of miners
title: Nigerian court orders UK to pay £420m over 1949 killing of miners
content: The colonial police, made up of Nigerians and Europeans, shot dead workers striking for better conditions.

originalTitle: Fisherman fleeing elephants killed by crocodile in Zambia
title: Fisherman fleeing elephants killed by crocodile in Zambia

originalTitle: Dozens of Muslims 'massacred' in Nigeria for refusing to join jihadists, says governor
title: Helping Hands After Sad Times in Nigeria
content:
Hello, wonderful friends! Your kid-friendly reporter from Africa is here. Today, we are going to talk about something important that happened in our big, beautiful country called Nigeria. Nigeria is a land full of sunshine, happy people, and amazing animals. It's a place where many different families live together, speaking many different languages, and sharing lots of smiles. But sometimes, even in the happiest places, sad things can happen. Recently, in a part of Nigeria, there was a time when some people were very scared and hurt. It reminds us that being kind and peaceful is so very important.

What Happened?

There was a group of people who wanted everyone to join their team and do things their way. They were not being kind or gentle. Many good people in a town did not want to join this group. These good people just wanted to live peacefully and happily, just like before. They believed in being kind and taking care of each other. Because they said 'no' to the group, the group caused trouble. It made many people very sad and scared. Some people had to leave their homes very quickly because they were worried. Imagine having to leave your favourite toy behind! It was a very hard time for them. Sadly, many people were hurt because of this trouble. And some, very sadly, lost their lives. This means they are no longer with their families and friends. We think about 78 people are now missed very much by their loved ones. And maybe even more, up to 170 people, are no longer with their families. This made many hearts very heavy and sad.

Did You Know?

Nigeria is the country with the most people in all of Africa! It has more than 200 million people! That's a lot of friends!

Why Did This Happen?

Sometimes, some people make bad choices. They think that by making others scared, they can get what they want. They try to make everyone think like them or do things their way, even if it's not good or kind. But we know that the best way to live is with love, kindness, and respect for everyone. It's important to remember that most people in the world are good and kind, and they want to help. These bad groups are often called 'jihadists' by grown-ups. It just means they are people who try to make everyone follow their rules, even if their rules are not fair or safe for others.

Helping Hands and Kind Hearts

Even when sad things happen, there is always hope. Many good people are coming together to help. When people had to leave their homes, other kind people opened their doors. They shared food, water, and comforting hugs. They made sure that children had a safe place to sleep and a warm meal to eat. Local leaders and special helpers are working very hard to make sure everyone is safe. They want to make sure the bad group does not cause trouble again. They are also helping families find each other and making sure everyone gets the care they need.

Did You Know?

Nigeria has beautiful beaches, big rivers, and even a place where you can see wonderful waterfalls! It's a land of many natural treasures.

Peace is Possible

This sad event reminds us how important peace is. Peace means everyone can play together, learn together, and live without being scared. It means we can share our toys and our smiles. When everyone chooses peace, our communities become strong and happy. It's like when you play with your friends. If everyone shares and is kind, the game is fun. But if someone is mean or tries to take all the toys, it makes everyone sad. Peace is like everyone sharing and being kind, all the time.

Looking Forward

The people in Nigeria are strong and brave. They are helping each other heal. The government and many kind groups are working to make sure that children can go back to school, and families can rebuild their lives. They want everyone to feel safe and happy again. They are building new homes and finding new ways to help everyone live in peace. It takes time, but with lots of love and helping hands, things can get better. We send our biggest smiles and kindest thoughts to all the children and families in Nigeria who are going through a tough time. Remember, even a small act of kindness can make a big difference!

Did You Know?

Nigeria is known for its amazing music and movies! People all over Africa love Nigerian stories and songs. Let's all remember to be kind to each other every day. Our world becomes a better place with every smile, every share, and every gentle word. Stay happy and keep shining, little stars of Africa!
summary: In Nigeria, a kind community faced trouble when a bad group caused harm, making many people sad and scared, but now everyone is working together to help and find peace again.
whyMatters: This story matters because it shows that even when bad things happen, people come together to help each other, reminding us that kindness and working for peace are very important for everyone to feel safe and happy.

title: 'Football aspect of Liverpool season not so important after Jota'

originalTitle: Why should I not express how I feel? - Guardiola
title: Why should I not express how I feel? - Guardiola
content: Pep Guardiola defended his stance of speaking up about global conflicts by asking, "why should I not express what I feel, just because I am a manager?"
